meanings.definition: To tie or fasten (a shoe or garment) again.
meanings.sent1: She relaced her sneakers before going for a run.
meanings.sent2: He relaced his boots to make sure they wouldn't fall off.
meanings.sent3: After tripping on her shoelaces, she relaced them tightly.
meanings.sent4: The team captain relaced his cleats for the championship game.
meanings.sent5: The hiker relaced his hiking boots for better support on the trail.

meanings.definition: To repair or strengthen (a relationship or connection).
meanings.sent1: They relaced their friendship after a misunderstanding.
meanings.sent2: Counseling sessions helped them relace their marriage.
meanings.sent3: The siblings relaced their bond over a shared love for music.
meanings.sent4: Laughter can relace even the strongest of relationships.
meanings.sent5: Kind words can relace a strained relationship with warmth and understanding.

meanings.definition: To replace or renew (something that has been removed or lost).
meanings.sent1: She relaced the missing button on her coat.
meanings.sent2: He relaced the broken shoelace with a new one.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to relace the burnt dish with a fresh one.
meanings.sent4: The artist relaced the faded colors in her painting.
meanings.sent5: The gardener relaced the wilted flowers with vibrant blooms.
